result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are: 13CF-394, 14CF-53, 14CF-54 and 14CF-183.

9:02 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
13CF-394: Defendant will plead to Count 2 and 3 and 4. Count 1 dismised and read in. imposed/stayed 1 yr jail, 36 mo prob, $500 fine/costs, domestic abuse surcharge, 6 mo jail, 80 hrs com svc at parks dept, AODA and comply, abs sob, mental health, obt/ mtn ft empt school, domestic abuse alt prog, other counseling, no weapons, letter of apology to victim and no abusive contact with victim. Other counts 36 mo probation and costs
14CF-53: Defendant will plead to Count 1. wihld sentence, 36 mo, costs, DNA surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Submit DNA sample if not submitted yet. If revoked, any sentence imposed would be consecutive to any sentence imposed in 13CF-394. 
14CF-54: Defendant will plead to Count 1. 36 mo prob, costs. If revoked, sentence would be consecutive to all other sentences imposed.
14CF-183: Dismissed and Read In.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF-394 Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 13CF-394 Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 13CF-394 Count 4: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-53 Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-54: Count 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim does not wish to make a statement today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CF-394 Count 2: Reckless driving causing bodily harm
13CF-394 Count 3: Battery, Domestic related
13CF-394 Count 4: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic related
13CF-394 Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-53 Count 1: Felony Bailjumping
14CF-54 Count 1: Felony Bailjumping
14CF-183: Dismissed and Read In

Parties are prepared to go forward without a PSI being ordered.
Court questions Atty Drengler for clarifications.
Defendant wishes to go to sentencing today.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court prior to sentencing, there is 105 days of credit.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court believes plea agreement is fair and apporpriate.

BY THE COURT:
13CF-394:
Count 2:
Jail sentence of 1 Year, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $500 plus costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge
Jail sentence of 120 Days
105 Jail Days Credit
Perform 80 hours of community service, preferrably at the Portage County Parks Department if applicable
AODA Assesment and comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Sign all releases 
Use one pharmacy to fill perscriptions
Perform a mental health assessment and comply with recommendations
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time, if agent feels schooling is appropriate
Attend and complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Do not possess any dangerous weapons during term of probation
Write a letter of apology to the victim
No abusive contact with the victim

Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Concurrent to Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Concurrent to Count 2 and Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2 and Count 3
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge

14CF-53:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Concurrent to 13CF-394
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CF-394
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Submit to DNA sample if not done so yet
Pay costs

14CF-54:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Concurrent to 13CF-394 and 14CF-53
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CF-394 and 14CF-53
Pay costs

All bonds posted are to be applied to fines and costs.
Plea hearing on August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

6/23/14 DJW: Bond modified to allow for non-abusive contact with his wife while he is incarcerated. 
Comply with the terms of bonds in 13CF394, 14CF53, 14CF54.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued.

Parties will speak to the 

Defense moves the Court for modification of bond as to the no contact.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in custody. Louis J Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Molepske anticipates a waiver. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in custody. Louis J Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:16 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Defendant is requesting an adjournment.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, defense witness is not available today but requesting this matter be adjourned. 

Matter is adjourned to the next intake day Br 3 has it. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Drury for Ryan W Drengler. ADA Knaapen for DA Molepski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Drury requests matter be rescheduled as Atty Drengler was not able to appear today and was going to have a prelim hearing.
BTC: Granted  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in custody. Louis J Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Drengler makes arguments in support of the bond modification. 
Atty Molepske makes arguments in opposition to the motion. 
Atty Drengler makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Motion is denied. 
The no contact that has been entered is appropriate as well as the bond as originally set.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz appeared by video. Attorney Ryan W Drengler in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Atty Drengler does not waive the preliminary hearing time limits.  Makes bond arguments to the Court.  Working at Firkus Masonry and will lose his job if he does not return this week.  Wife is unemployed.  Would lose insurance and the ability to pay for psychotropic medication.   Safety plan will be in place and would be returning to work. 
Requests bond be modified to $500 cash.  
Atty Cousins opposes modification at this time.  He is not the attorney assigned to this case.  Makes arguments. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court resided over the bond hearing when originally set.  Court will continue bond at $2,500 cash.  Court set the PTC on the remaining files 13CF394, 14CF53 & 14cF54 for 6/16 at 10:00 a.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Jennifer Wojtalewicz. 
comply with the terms of bonds in 13CF394, 14CF53, 14CF54.

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Ryan Drengler appears in Court.  He anticipates being appointed on this case as well. 

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping, Criminal Damage to Property/Domestic.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Molepske recommends a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
